intro: Freycinetia merrillii, commonly known as the Bornean palm, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Arecaceae family. It is native to Borneo and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense inflorescences, which are typically borne on the upper part of the stem. Freycinetia merrillii is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to humid, tropical conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
